content: eor after round 20 you will have 13+22 stitches on the side of the gusset and 22 stitches round 15 k12 sm m1 knit till eor on the opposite side - total of 57 stitches round 16 k12 sm m1 knit till eor separating for thumb and finishing after round 17/20 continue as follows left mitten slip bor marker to the right needle knit 20/22 stitches to the next marker remove the marker remove the next 12/13 stitches onto the waste yarn using a tapestry needle knit till the end of round make sure that you knit the first stitch after the thumb pretty tight so that there is no hole there later ©irishhomestead 2019 5 right mitten slip bor marker to the right needle remove the next 12/13 stitches onto the waste yarn using a tapestry needle remove the next marker knit till the end of round make sure that you knit the first stitch of the round pretty tight so that there is no hole there later continue for both mittens you are now back to 40/44 stitches on the needles and 12/13 thumb stitches are on the waste yarn knit 10/12 rounds in stockinette knit all start colorwork join color b and knit row 1 - 7 of the chart observe your gauge as colorwork knitting tends to be a bit tighter that stockinette if you see that your colorwork is too tight you might want to switch over to needles half a size larger e g 3 5 mm colour a colour b change to size a needles and knit 1x1 ribbing for 4 row or till required length is achieved approx 1 cm to the tip of your pinkie cast off using your preferred method of stretchy bind off sample mittens have been finished using tubular bind off thumb move 12/13 stitches on the waste yarn onto size b needle pick 4 / 5 stitches from the side of the gusset you now have 16/18 stitches on your needles place bor marker and continue knitting in stockinette for 10/12 rounds change to size a needles and knit 2 row of 2x2 ribbing cast off using your preferred method of stretchy bind off sample mittens have been finished using tubular bind off finishing off weave in all the ends wash and block if needed ©irishhomestead 2019 6 thank you so much for getting a copy of this pattern i hope that you will enjoy knitting it and that these mittens will keep your hands warm and cosy if you have any questions regarding the pattern please feel free to email me tania at info irishhomestead@gmail com i would love to see your finished objects so if you are on instagram make sure to share your work in progress or finished piece with the #irishhomesteaddesigns and tag me @irishhomestead and don t forget to create your project page on ravelry thank you have a lovely day ©irishhomestead 2019 7
